summary: Simple syntax highlighting for the OpenSCAD language
name: openscad.vim
description:
This is a quick hack at syntax highlighting for the OpenSCAD 3D modeling language -- http://www.openscad.org/

Note that at the moment it doesn&#039t help detect errors such as mismatched blocks and parens.

TODOs include error management and auto filetype setup.

I would appreciate feedback and suggestions for improvement, please use the script wiki link above.
install_details:
Copy to ../syntax/ directory. Until automatic filetype setup is complete, at the moment you have to manually do:

:set filetype=openscad

when editing OpenSCAD files so that syntax highlighting is enabled.

You can automate this by adding the following autocmd to your vimrc:

au! BufRead,BufNewFile *.scad		set filetype=openscad

versions.release_notes: Added some missing keywords, better compliance with vim syntax guidelines.
